goals.question: What is the distribution of driving hours per week?
goals.visualization: Histogram of driving hours per week
goals.rationale: This tells us about the typical amount of time people spend driving per week and if there are any outliers.

goals.question: Is there a correlation between age and driving hours per week?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of age vs. driving hours per week
goals.rationale: This helps us understand if there is a relationship between age and driving habits.

goals.question: What is the distribution of miles driven per week?
goals.visualization: Histogram of miles driven per week
goals.rationale: This tells us about the typical distance people travel by car per week and if there are any outliers.

goals.question: What is the distribution of fuel efficiency for the cars driven?
goals.rationale: This helps us understand the fuel efficiency of the cars driven and if there are any outliers.

goals.question: Is there a correlation between miles driven per week and fuel efficiency?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of miles driven per week vs. fuel efficiency
goals.rationale: This helps us understand if there is a relationship between the distance traveled and the fuel efficiency of the cars driven.

code:
```
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data = data.dropna(subset=['hours_driving'])
    sns.histplot(data=data, x='hours_driving', kde=True, color='blue')
    plt.axvline(data['hours_driving'].median(), color='red', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=1, label='Median = {:.2f}'.format(data['hours_driving'].median()))
    plt.xlabel('Hours of Driving per Week')
    plt.ylabel('Frequency')
    plt.legend()
    plt.title('What is the distribution of driving hours per week?', wrap=True)
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    return plt

chart = plot(data)
```

```
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data = data.dropna()
    plt.scatter(data['age'], data['driving_hours_per_week'], color='blue')
    plt.xlabel('Age')
    plt.ylabel('Driving Hours per Week')
    plt.title('Is there a correlation between age and driving hours per week?')
    return plt

chart = plot(data)
```

```
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    sns.histplot(data=data, x='miles_driven_per_week', kde=True, color='blue')
    plt.axvline(data['miles_driven_per_week'].mean(), color='red', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=1, label='Mean')
    plt.axvline(data['miles_driven_per_week'].median(), color='green', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=1, label='Median')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of miles driven per week?', wrap=True)
    plt.legend()
    plt.xlabel('Miles Driven per Week')
    plt.ylabel('Frequency')
    return plt

chart = plot(data)
```

```
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data = data.dropna(subset=['fuel_efficiency'])
    sns.histplot(data=data, x='fuel_efficiency', kde=True, color='blue')
    plt.axvline(data['fuel_efficiency'].mean(), color='red', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=1, label=f"Mean: {data['fuel_efficiency'].mean():.2f}")
    plt.axvline(data['fuel_efficiency'].median(), color='green', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=1, label=f"Median: {data['fuel_efficiency'].median():.2f}")
    plt.legend()
    plt.xlabel('Fuel Efficiency')
    plt.ylabel('Frequency')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of fuel efficiency for the cars driven?')
    return plt

chart = plot(data)
```

```
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data = data.dropna(subset=['miles_driven_per_week', 'fuel_efficiency'])
    plt.scatter(data['miles_driven_per_week'], data['fuel_efficiency'], color='blue')
    plt.xlabel('Miles Driven per Week')
    plt.ylabel('Fuel Efficiency')
    plt.title('Is there a correlation between miles driven per week and fuel efficiency?')
    return plt

chart = plot(data)
```
